results.title: Farming with a difference
results.brief_description: The secret of successful farming is scientific management. At a demonstration farm at Hobbs Cross, visiting farmers come to garner the fruits of research. Hobbs Cross is shown to be a practical house of notions that farmers can adapt to their own needs and pockets.
results.description: The secret of successful farming is scientific management. At a demonstration farm at Hobbs Cross, visiting farmers come to garner the fruits of research. Hobbs Cross is shown to be a practical house of notions that farmers can adapt to their own needs and pockets.

results.title: Farming the forest for woodchip
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film concentrates on the process involved in the production of woodchips in the Eden area of New South Wales, from tree-felling to the shipment of chips to Japan. The film stresses that the logged areas will rejuvenate naturally thus allowing continual use of the forest. For a more critical view of woodchipping see “The Vanishing forest”. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Farming in South China: Si River Valley
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: Rich river basin areas make good agricultural lands. In these densely populated areas, thousands of families live by intensive subsistence farming. Land is very scarce. Farm families in the Si River Valley do their own work with crude tools with rice being the dominant crop providing more food value per acre than other grain crops grown in the region. Poverty prevails among most of the population. However there still seems to be happiness among the people as they engage in the coninuous routine of tilling the soil and reaping scant harvests on which they manage to exist.

results.title: Farming for the future
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Shan Benson, Geoffrey Bell, Shell Company of Australia and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The basic causes of wind and water erosion in Australia, and how in the Mallee areas wind erosion is being checked. Farming for the future means a new approach to old problems, since the farmers themselves suffer most from the effects of impoverished land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Collings, Shan Benson, Geoffrey Bell, Shell Company of Australia and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Farming 2000
results.brief_description: Covers a conference held in 1983 by the Australian Rural Adjustment Unit and the National Farmers Federation. The conference examined the major issues facing rural Australia during the 1980’s.

results.title: Farmers of India: the Middle Ganges Valley
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens, Louis De Rochemont, Louis de Rochemont Associates and United Films
results.brief_description: Describes aspects of the life of an Indian family near Benares in the fertile Ganges Valley. The film shows methods of farming used in different seasons and emphasises the dependence of most Indians on the soil for their supply of food. Crop failure means starvation. A visit to the city of Benares is shown and the religious rituals observed at the sacred Ganges River are described. The film illustrates aspects of both country and city life in the Ganges Valley.

results.title: Farmers in business
results.creator_credit: Rae Evans, Anthony Isaacs, Rayant Pictures and Cygnet Films
results.brief_description: The role played by farmers’ co-operatives in the farming community: illustrated in particular by the progress of one flourishing society established in 1911, and operating in the border country of England and Scotland. Bulk buying and processing, communal marketing, depots for engineers and other supplies, agricultural pharmacies, and such specialised services as aerial spraying are among its many activities.

results.title: Farmer Charley
results.brief_description: One of the cartoon series featuring the character “Charley”. In this film Charley is willed a half-interest in a farm and has rosy dreams of rustic bliss, but the reality shows him that a farmer’s life requires expert knowledge and scientific skill - as well as good hard work.

results.title: Farmer-fishermen: Norway
results.creator_credit: Ronald Craigen, Louis De Rochemont and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Shows how long winters and poor land make it necessary for the people of Norway to farm in the summer and supplement their income by fishing during the winter. Reveals the customs, characteristics and family life of the Norwegian people.

results.title: Farm work: equipment maintenance. Ep. 4. Reconditioning a grain drill
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Calvin Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how those parts of the grain drill which are commonly subject to most wear are checked and repaired. Shows how to clean and lubricate the seeding mechanism; how to inspect and repair the disc furrow openers; how to inspect and clean the seed tubes; how to clean and repair the drive chain and sprockets; how to check the clutch and adjust the pressure springs; how to inspect and repair the drive wheel mechanism and how to calibrate the seeding mechanism.
